description:
Viruses are the tiniest but most numerous inhabitants of Earth. Although
viruses notoriously cause deadly epidemics, not all viruses are bad and
many are beneficial to their hosts and vital for ecosystem health. This
course explores the ‘good, bad and ugly’ effects of viruses on biological
systems. We examine how viruses invade host genomes, thwart host
defenses, stymie conservation efforts, and change human history through
deadly epidemics. But we also explore virus benefits, especially in
biotechnology: biocontrol of pests, anti-cancer treatments, and therapies
targeting other pathogens. Viruses dominate the planet, affecting our lives
for better and for worse.
title: Viruses: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly
